sentences.sContent: I watched the first few episodes, but soon lost interest.
sentences.sCn: 我看了前几集，但很快就失去了兴趣。

sentences.sContent: The last round of bidding aroused considerable interest.
sentences.sCn: 最后一轮竞价引起人们相当大的兴趣。

sentences.sContent: Our survey reveals a disturbing lack of interest in teacher training.
sentences.sCn: 我们的调查显示人们对教师培训失去了兴趣，这很令人不安。

sentences.sContent: I read your article with great interest.
sentences.sCn: 我兴致勃勃地拜读了您的文章。

sentences.sContent: ...it was another interest that led Leah to radically reinvent herself...
...people like Veiseh are of great interest to neuroscientists hoping to understand the way the brain records our lives...
...people take aging research as just an interest area where they can try to develop interventions...
...The decline in interest in literary fiction is also one of the causes identified by Leslie...
...can I interest you in a pork special with serving tonight...
...It is in no one's interest to keep a large segment of the population on the margins of society...
...ff they don't develop an interest of reading during this critical period...
...Retirees are earning near-zero interest on their savings...
...I interpreted people's interest in our business collection as the first step to pursuing their dreams...

synos.tran: 兴趣，爱好；[金融]利息；趣味；同行

phrases.pCn: 个人利益；个人兴趣爱好
利益冲突；公职人员对公众义务与其本身利益相冲突
一般利益；一般娱乐；大众兴趣

words.tran: 有趣的；引起兴趣的，令人关注的
感兴趣的；有权益的；有成见的

trans.tranCn: 兴趣；利益，利害关系；利息
trans.tranOther: if you have an interest in something or someone, you want to know or learn more about them
to make someone want to pay attention to something and find out more about it
